Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup, possibly a type B cup; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of a Dionysiac scene; middle part of a figure (Dionysos or a maenad) in chiton and himation, moving to right; on right, part of a vine branch and bunch of grapes with added red for vine leaves and outline of bunch of grapes; single grapes are raised black dots on black; relief-contour.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 511-2, no. C79)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 237, no. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0651) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (pl. 14, no. 16)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
